016package com.googlecode.catchexception.apis;
017
018import com.googlecode.catchexception.CatchException;
019import com.googlecode.catchexception.ThrowingCallable;
020
021/**
022 * Supports <a
023 * href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavior_Driven_Development">BDD</a>-like
024 * approach to catch and verify exceptions (<i>given/when/then</i>).
025 *
026 * EXAMPLE:
027 *
028 * {@code
029 *
030 * import static org.assertj.core.api.BDDAssertions.then;
031 *
032 * // given an empty list
033 * List myList = new ArrayList();
034 *
035 * // when we try to get the first element of the list
036 * when(myList).get(1);
037 *
038 * // then we expect an IndexOutOfBoundsException
039 * then(caughtException())
040 *     .isInstanceOf(IndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
041 *     .hasMessage("Index: 1, Size: 0")
042 *     .hasNoCause();
043 *
044 * // then we expect an IndexOutOfBoundsException (alternatively)
045 * thenThrown(IndexOutOfBoundsException.class);
046 * }
047 *
048 *
049 * @author rwoo
050 * @author mariuszs
051 * @since 1.3.0
052 */
053public class BDDCatchException {
054
055        /**
056         * @param actor The instance that shall be proxied. Must not be
057         *              <code>null</code>.
058         * @see com.googlecode.catchexception.CatchException#catchException(ThrowingCallable)
059         */
060        public static void when(ThrowingCallable actor) {
061                CatchException.catchException(actor);
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Returns the exception caught during the last call in the current thread. This is useful for
066         * returning business specific exception to specific assertions.
067         *
068         * @return Returns the exception caught during the last call in the current
069         * thread - if the call was made through a proxy that has been created via
070         * {@link #when(ThrowingCallable)} . Returns null when no exception was caught.
071         */
072        public static Exception caughtException() {
073                return CatchException.caughtException();
074        }
075
076        public static <E extends Exception> E caughtException(Class<E> caughtExceptionType) {
077                return CatchException.caughtException(caughtExceptionType);
078        }
079
080        /**
081         * Throws an assertion if no exception is thrown or if an exception of an
082         * unexpected type is thrown.
083         *
084         * EXAMPLE:
085         *
086         * {@code
087         *
088         * // given a list with nine members
089         * List myList = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9);
090         *
091         * // when we try to get the 500th member of the fellowship
092         * when(myList).get(500);
093         *
094         * // then we expect an IndexOutOfBoundsException
095         * thenThrown(IndexOutOfBoundsException.class);
096         * }
097         *
098         *
099         * @param actualExceptionClazz the expected type of the caught exception.
100         */
101        @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
102        public static void thenThrown(Class actualExceptionClazz) {
103                CatchExceptionUtils.thenThrown(actualExceptionClazz);
104        }
105
106}
